database_info.name: Global Media Database
database_info.purpose: Comprehensive global news sources for Claude news-intelligence skill
database_info.creator: Mother Of Chaos

credibility_ratings.high: Rigorous fact-checking, transparent corrections, strong editorial standards

legitimacy_criteria.tier_1: Automatic inclusion - Established outlets 50+ years, major awards, paper of record status, IFCN certification
legitimacy_criteria.tier_2: Credentialed individuals - Professional journalism background, verified credentials
legitimacy_criteria.tier_3: Emerging quality - Transparent practices, documented fact-checking

usage_notes.for_claude_skill: Cross-reference articles from different political leans and regions. Prioritize high credibility. Use geographic diversity to avoid Western-centric bias.
usage_notes.fact_checking_method: 1) Identify claims 2) Search across political spectrum 3) Check consistency 4) Flag opinion vs fact 5) Note disagreements
usage_notes.bias_handling: Political lean ≠ unreliable. High credibility sources with clear lean are valuable for understanding perspectives.

global_news_agencies.name: Associated Press (AP)
global_news_agencies.specialty: Breaking news, wire service, global coverage
global_news_agencies.notes: Moved from Lean Left to Left (Nov 2024). Cooperative owned by member newspapers. Pulitzer Prize winner. IFCN certified fact-checker.

global_news_agencies.name: Reuters
global_news_agencies.specialty: Financial news, international breaking news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: One of 'Big Three' global agencies. Owned by Thomson Reuters. Multiple Pulitzer Prizes. Reuters Fact Check certified by IFCN.

global_news_agencies.name: Agence France-Presse (AFP)
global_news_agencies.specialty: International news, wire service, global coverage
global_news_agencies.notes: One of 'Big Three' global agencies. 2,400 journalists in 260 bureaus across 151 countries. AFP Fact Check certified by IFCN.

global_news_agencies.name: ANSA (Agenzia Nazionale Stampa Associata)
global_news_agencies.notes: Non-profit cooperative, 36 member newspapers. 81 offices in 78 countries. IFCN-certified fact-checker. Italy's leading news agency.

global_news_agencies.name: Deutsche Presse-Agentur (DPA)
global_news_agencies.specialty: German and European news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: Germany's largest news agency. Cooperative owned by German media companies. IFCN fact-checker. About 1,000 journalists worldwide.

global_news_agencies.name: EFE
global_news_agencies.specialty: Spanish and Latin American news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: Spain's international news agency. Fourth largest wire service globally. EFE Verifica fact-checking service.

global_news_agencies.name: Xinhua News Agency
global_news_agencies.notes: Official state press agency of China. Directly controlled by Communist Party. Useful for understanding Chinese government perspective but NOT independent journalism.

global_news_agencies.name: TASS (Russian News Agency)
global_news_agencies.notes: State-owned news agency. Official government mouthpiece. Useful for understanding Russian government perspective but NOT independent journalism.

global_news_agencies.name: Press Trust of India (PTI)
global_news_agencies.notes: India's largest news agency. Non-profit cooperative. 500+ journalists across India. Provides news to most Indian publications.

global_news_agencies.name: Kyodo News
global_news_agencies.notes: Japan's leading news agency. Nonprofit cooperative owned by member newspapers and broadcasters. About 50 bureaus worldwide.

italy.name: Corriere della Sera
italy.specialty: General news, Italy's national newspaper of record
italy.notes: Italy's most-read and oldest newspaper. Balanced/impartial reporting. 9M+ monthly website visitors. Over 500K digital subscribers.

italy.name: La Repubblica
italy.notes: Second most-circulated Italian newspaper. Owned by GEDI/Agnelli family. Known for culture, intellect, fact-checking.

italy.name: Internazionale
italy.notes: Translates best articles from international press. 123,000 weekly circulation. Organizes annual journalism festival. Crucially independent.

italy.name: il Fatto Quotidiano
italy.notes: Third most-visited news site. Refuses government subsidies. Rated most independent and trustworthy online Italian news.

italy.name: Il Sole 24 Ore
italy.notes: Italy's leading business newspaper. Owned by Confindustria. High credibility in financial reporting.

italy.name: La Stampa
italy.notes: Turin-based newspaper. Part of GEDI group. Third-largest circulation in Italy. Strong northern Italy presence.

spain.name: El País
spain.notes: Spain's highest-circulation daily. Center-left editorial line. Owned by PRISA. Strong international coverage.

spain.name: El Mundo
spain.notes: Spain's second-largest newspaper. Center-right lean. Known for investigative reporting. Owned by Unidad Editorial.

spain.name: elDiario.es
spain.notes: Reader-funded independent model. Financially successful. Third most-visited news site in Spain.

spain.name: CTXT (Revista Contexto)
spain.specialty: Long-form analysis, political & economic context, culture
spain.notes: Founded by journalists from El País, El Mundo, La Repubblica. Focus on in-depth journalism. Progressive International member.

spain.name: ABC
spain.notes: Spain's third-largest newspaper. Right-leaning, monarchist tradition. Historically significant. Owned by Vocento.

spain.name: La Vanguardia
spain.notes: Barcelona-based. Spain's oldest continuously published newspaper. Center editorial line. Strong Catalan coverage.

spain.name: El Confidencial
spain.notes: Leading online-native Spanish outlet. Center editorial line. Strong business and political coverage.

france.name: Le Monde
france.notes: France's newspaper of record. Center-left editorial line. Employee-owned. Les Décodeurs fact-checking team.

france.name: Le Figaro
france.notes: France's oldest national newspaper. Center-right editorial line. High circulation. Owned by Dassault Group.

france.name: Mediapart
france.notes: Subscription-only, no ads. 220,000+ paid subscribers. Broken major scandals. NYT calls it 'France's leading investigative news site'.

france.name: Libération
france.notes: Left-wing daily newspaper. Co-founded by Jean-Paul Sartre. Strong cultural and political coverage.

france.name: L'Obs (Le Nouvel Observateur)
france.notes: Weekly news magazine. Left-center perspective. High-quality analysis and cultural coverage.

france.name: Le Parisien
france.notes: Paris regional daily with national edition. Center editorial line. Popular mainstream newspaper.

germany.name: Der Spiegel
germany.notes: Germany's leading news magazine. Center-left. Known for investigative reporting. English edition Spiegel International.

germany.name: Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ)
germany.notes: Germany's newspaper of record. Center-right. High-quality journalism. Strong business coverage.

germany.name: CORRECTIV
germany.notes: Germany's first nonprofit investigative newsroom. Staff of 70+. Runs CORRECTIV.Faktencheck. GIJN member. Multiple awards.

germany.name: Die Zeit
germany.notes: Germany's most widely read weekly newspaper. Center editorial line. Known for long-form journalism and intellectual discourse.

germany.name: Süddeutsche Zeitung
germany.notes: Germany's largest subscription newspaper. Center-left. Broke Panama Papers story. Strong investigative team.

germany.name: taz (die tageszeitung)
germany.notes: Left-wing cooperative newspaper. Independent, reader-supported. Known for environmental and social justice coverage.

uk.name: BBC News
uk.notes: UK public broadcaster. Funded by TV license fee. Editorial independence. BBC Reality Check fact-checking. Available in 40+ languages.

uk.name: The Guardian
uk.notes: UK left-leaning quality newspaper. Owned by Scott Trust. Reader-funded model. Strong environmental coverage. Multiple Pulitzers.

uk.name: The Telegraph
uk.notes: UK conservative quality newspaper. Owned by Barclay family. Strong political coverage.

uk.name: Financial Times
uk.notes: Leading global business newspaper. Center editorial line. Owned by Nikkei. High-quality analysis.

uk.name: The Times
uk.notes: UK newspaper of record. Center-right. Owned by News UK (Murdoch). High editorial standards.

uk.name: The Independent
uk.notes: Online-only since 2016. Left-center lean. Originally founded as politically independent newspaper.

usa.name: The New York Times
usa.notes: US newspaper of record. Left-center editorial line. 130+ Pulitzer Prizes. Strong international bureau.

usa.name: The Washington Post
usa.notes: Major US newspaper. Center-left. Owned by Jeff Bezos. 69 Pulitzer Prizes. Fact Checker column.

usa.name: The Wall Street Journal
usa.notes: Leading US business newspaper. News section center, opinion section right. Owned by News Corp. 37 Pulitzer Prizes.

usa.name: NPR (National Public Radio)
usa.notes: US public radio. Membership-funded. Left-center lean. High-quality journalism. 1,000+ member stations.

usa.name: ProPublica
usa.notes: Independent nonprofit newsroom. Won 6 Pulitzer Prizes. Focuses on accountability journalism. No paywall.

usa.name: The Atlantic
usa.notes: American magazine of literature, culture, and politics. Left-center lean. High-quality long-form journalism.

canada.name: CBC News
canada.notes: Canada's public broadcaster. Left-center lean. Funded by government but editorially independent.

canada.name: The Globe and Mail
canada.notes: Canada's newspaper of record. Center editorial line. High-quality journalism.

latin_america.name: El Faro
latin_america.notes: Latin America's first online-only publication. ALiados network member. Multiple journalism awards.

latin_america.name: Agência Pública
latin_america.notes: Brazil's first nonprofit investigative journalism agency. ALiados network member. Co-founder won Cabot Prize 2024.

latin_america.name: Animal Político
latin_america.notes: Major Mexican digital outlet. ALiados network member. El Sabueso fact-checking project.

latin_america.name: CIPER Chile
latin_america.notes: Center for Investigative Journalism. ALiados network member. Based at Universidad Diego Portales.

latin_america.name: Plaza Pública
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Operates under challenging press freedom conditions.

latin_america.name: IDL-Reporteros
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Strong investigative team.

latin_america.name: Armando.info
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Focus on Venezuelan corruption. Operates in exile.

latin_america.name: Runrun.es
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Major Venezuelan digital outlet despite government pressure.

latin_america.name: Confidencial
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Operating in exile since 2021.

latin_america.name: El Surtidor
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Young but credible Paraguayan outlet.

latin_america.name: Chequeado
latin_america.notes: IFCN-certified fact-checker. Pioneer in Latin American fact-checking.

latin_america.name: Efecto Cocuyo
latin_america.notes: Main independent digital news site in Venezuela. Operating despite repression.

brazil.name: Folha de S.Paulo
brazil.notes: Brazil's most influential newspaper. Center-left. Family-owned. Strong investigative team.

brazil.name: O Globo
brazil.notes: Major Brazilian newspaper. Center. Part of Grupo Globo media conglomerate.

japan.name: The Japan Times
japan.notes: Japan's oldest English-language newspaper. Independent voice in Japanese media landscape.

japan.name: NHK World
japan.notes: Japan's public broadcaster. Center editorial line. International service.

japan.name: Asahi Shimbun
japan.notes: Japan's second-largest newspaper. Left-center lean. High editorial standards. English edition available.

india.name: The Hindu
india.notes: Major Indian newspaper. Center-left. High editorial standards. Family-owned. Oldest English daily.

india.name: The Times of India
india.notes: India's largest English newspaper. Center. Owned by Bennett Coleman. Mass market focus.

india.name: The Indian Express
india.notes: Major Indian newspaper. Center editorial line. Known for investigative journalism and editorial independence.

australia.name: ABC News (Australia)
australia.notes: Australia's public broadcaster. Center editorial line. Editorially independent.

australia.name: The Sydney Morning Herald
australia.notes: Major Australian newspaper. Center-left. Owned by Nine Entertainment. Australia's oldest continuously published newspaper.

australia.name: The Age
australia.notes: Melbourne-based newspaper. Center-left. Owned by Nine Entertainment. Strong Victorian coverage.

asia_pacific.name: The Straits Times
asia_pacific.notes: Singapore's newspaper of record. Government-linked ownership affects independence. Useful for Singapore perspective.

asia_pacific.name: The Jakarta Post
asia_pacific.notes: Indonesia's leading English-language daily. Center editorial line. Important voice in Southeast Asia.

asia_pacific.name: Philippine Daily Inquirer
asia_pacific.notes: Philippines' most widely read newspaper. Center editorial line. Strong investigative tradition.

middle_east.name: Haaretz
middle_east.notes: Israel's oldest daily newspaper. Left-leaning, critical of Israeli government. High editorial standards.

middle_east.name: The Times of Israel
middle_east.notes: Independent online newspaper. Center editorial line. English-language focus.

middle_east.name: Al Jazeera
middle_east.notes: Qatar state-funded. Straight news minimally biased, opinion pages exhibit bias. Covers underrepresented regions well.

middle_east.name: Middle East Eye
middle_east.notes: Independent news and analysis website. Left-center perspective. Focus on underreported Middle East stories.

middle_east.name: Al-Monitor
middle_east.notes: Independent Middle East news and analysis. Center editorial line. Employs regional journalists.

middle_east.name: The National (UAE)
middle_east.notes: UAE state-linked outlet. Center editorial line but government influence affects independence. Useful for UAE perspective.

africa.name: Daily Maverick
africa.notes: Leading South African independent news site. Center editorial line. Strong investigative team.

africa.name: Premium Times
africa.notes: Leading Nigerian investigative outlet. Center editorial line. ICFJ Knight International Journalism Award winner.

africa.name: News24 (South Africa)
africa.notes: Major South African news website. Center editorial line. Owned by Naspers/Media24.

africa.name: Nation Media Group
africa.notes: East Africa's largest independent media house. Publishes Daily Nation. Center editorial line.

science_health.name: Nature
science_health.notes: Leading multidisciplinary science journal. Rigorous peer review. High impact factor.

science_health.name: Science
science_health.notes: Published by AAAS. Rigorous peer review. Covers all scientific disciplines.

science_health.name: The Lancet
science_health.notes: Leading medical journal. Rigorous peer review. Global health focus.

science_health.name: NEJM (New England Journal of Medicine)
science_health.notes: Most prestigious medical journal. Highest impact factor in medicine. Rigorous standards.

science_health.name: JAMA (Journal of the American Medical Association)
science_health.notes: One of the most prestigious medical journals. Published by American Medical Association.

science_health.name: Scientific American
science_health.notes: Oldest continuously published magazine in US. Science for general audience. Evidence-based.

science_health.name: Science News
science_health.notes: Nonprofit science journalism. Covers all scientific disciplines. High accuracy.

science_health.name: New Scientist
science_health.notes: Weekly science magazine. Covers latest scientific developments. Accessible to general audience.

technology.name: Ars Technica
technology.notes: In-depth technology journalism. Technical accuracy. Owned by Condé Nast.

technology.name: The Verge
technology.notes: Technology news and reviews. Part of Vox Media. Strong editorial team.

technology.name: Wired
technology.notes: Technology and culture magazine. Owned by Condé Nast. Long-form journalism.

technology.name: TechCrunch
technology.notes: Leading tech news site. Startup focus. Owned by Yahoo/Verizon. Strong venture capital coverage.

technology.name: MIT Technology Review
technology.notes: Published by MIT. Focus on emerging technologies and their impact. High-quality analysis.

finance_business.name: Bloomberg
finance_business.notes: Leading financial news service. Real-time market data. Global bureaus.

finance_business.name: The Economist
finance_business.notes: Global news and analysis magazine. Classical liberal perspective. Anonymous journalism.

finance_business.name: Barron's
finance_business.notes: Leading investment news magazine. WSJ sister publication. Owned by News Corp. Focus on investors.

sports.name: ESPN
sports.notes: Leading sports network. Comprehensive coverage. Owned by Disney.

sports.name: The Athletic
sports.notes: Subscription sports journalism. No ads. High-quality reporting. Owned by NYT.

sports.name: BBC Sport
sports.notes: BBC's sports division. Comprehensive global sports coverage. Editorial independence.

visual_arts.name: Artforum
visual_arts.notes: Leading contemporary art magazine. International coverage. Prestigious.

visual_arts.name: Frieze
visual_arts.notes: Leading contemporary art and culture magazine. Associated with major art fairs.

visual_arts.name: Apollo
visual_arts.notes: International art magazine. Focus on art history and fine arts. High scholarly standards.

visual_arts.name: ArtNews
visual_arts.notes: Oldest art magazine in America. Comprehensive art world coverage.

visual_arts.name: Hyperallergic
visual_arts.notes: Independent online arts magazine. Progressive perspective. Critical voice.

visual_arts.name: Art in America
visual_arts.notes: Leading American art magazine. Focus on contemporary and modern art.

music.name: Pitchfork
music.notes: Influential music criticism. Indie/electronic focus. Owned by Condé Nast.

music.name: Rolling Stone
music.notes: Iconic music magazine. Rock/pop authority. Expanded to politics and culture.

music.name: NME (New Musical Express)
music.notes: British music journalism institution. Indie/alternative focus.

music.name: The Wire
music.notes: Focus on experimental, electronic, and avant-garde music. High credibility in niche.

music.name: Resident Advisor
music.notes: Leading electronic music magazine and event guide. Global coverage of dance music culture.

music.name: Mojo
music.notes: Focus on classic rock and music history. In-depth features and reviews.

music.name: Gramophone
music.notes: World's leading classical music magazine. Reviews recordings and performances. High scholarly standards.

film.name: Variety
film.notes: Leading entertainment trade publication. Industry standard.

film.name: Cahiers du Cinéma
film.notes: Legendary French film criticism magazine. Influential in film theory. Auteur theory birthplace.

film.name: Sight and Sound
film.notes: Published by British Film Institute. High scholarly standards. Famous critics' poll.

film.name: IndieWire
film.notes: Focus on independent and international cinema. Strong festival coverage.

film.name: Film Comment
film.notes: Published by Film Society of Lincoln Center. High-quality film criticism and theory. Focus on art cinema.

theater.name: American Theatre
theater.notes: Theatre Communications Group publication. National coverage of American theater.

theater.name: The Stage
theater.notes: Leading UK theater publication. Industry standard. Founded 1880.

theater.name: Playbill
theater.notes: American theater magazine and website. Focus on Broadway. Industry staple.

theater.name: Dance Magazine
theater.notes: Leading dance magazine in America. Covers ballet, modern, contemporary, and all dance forms. Industry standard.

literature.name: The Paris Review
literature.notes: Prestigious literary quarterly. Famous Art of Fiction interviews. High literary standards.

literature.name: London Review of Books
literature.notes: High-level intellectual discourse. Long-form reviews and essays.

literature.name: The New York Review of Books
literature.notes: Prestigious intellectual magazine. Long-form reviews and essays. High scholarly standards.

literature.name: Bookforum
literature.notes: High-quality literary magazine. Focus on contemporary books and ideas. Edited by Albert Mobilio.

architecture.name: Dezeen
architecture.notes: World's most visited architecture website. Online-native. Daily coverage of architecture and design.

architecture.name: ArchDaily
architecture.notes: Most visited architecture website. Global coverage. Daily project features.

architecture.name: Architectural Digest
architecture.notes: Leading architecture and design magazine. Focus on high-end residential design. Owned by Condé Nast.

independent_journalists.name: Heather Cox Richardson - Letters from an American
independent_journalists.notes: Professor of History at Boston College. 1.3M+ Substack subscribers. Daily historical context for current events.

independent_journalists.name: Matt Taibbi - Racket News
independent_journalists.notes: Former Rolling Stone journalist. Known for investigative reporting. Twitter Files contributor.

independent_journalists.name: Bari Weiss - The Free Press
independent_journalists.notes: Former NYT opinion editor. Focus on free speech and heterodox views. Controversial but credentialed.

independent_journalists.name: Glenn Greenwald
independent_journalists.notes: Pulitzer Prize winner (Snowden docs). Co-founder of The Intercept. Focus on civil liberties.

independent_journalists.name: Seymour Hersh
independent_journalists.notes: Pulitzer Prize winner. Broke My Lai massacre story. Legendary investigative journalist.

independent_journalists.name: 404 Media
independent_journalists.notes: Tech journalism collective. Subscription-based. Founded by former Vice Motherboard journalists.

independent_journalists.name: Defector
independent_journalists.notes: Worker-owned cooperative. Founded by former Deadspin staff. Sports and cultural commentary.

independent_journalists.name: Drop Site News
independent_journalists.notes: Founded by Jeremy Scahill (The Intercept co-founder). Focus on investigative reporting.

independent_journalists.name: Casey Newton - Platformer
independent_journalists.notes: Former The Verge journalist. Focus on tech platforms and Silicon Valley. High-quality tech journalism.

independent_journalists.name: Judd Legum - Popular Information
independent_journalists.notes: Former ThinkProgress editor. Focus on corporate accountability and political accountability.

independent_journalists.name: Andrew Sullivan - The Weekly Dish
independent_journalists.notes: Veteran political writer and blogger. Former editor at The New Republic. Known for long-form essays on politics and culture.

global_networks.name: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ)
global_networks.notes: Panama Papers, Pandora Papers, Paradise Papers. Global network of 280+ journalists in 100+ countries.

global_networks.name: Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP)
global_networks.notes: Global network of investigative journalists. Major cross-border investigations. Won multiple awards.

global_networks.name: Global Investigative Journalism Network (GIJN)
global_networks.notes: Network of 200+ organizations. Training, resources, conferences. Promotes investigative journalism worldwide.
